channel.title: Need help with run/Compiling server
channel.description: ok when ever I try and run it says compile.. but when i compile it says I am missing a java file.. what java file could I be missing.. and where would I get it? and yes.. I am tottally noob at this..

item.title: Need help with run/Compiling server

item.description:

ok I dont have any edit option on either of them the compiler nor the runserver. and do you have msn so you can comunicate like instantly? if yes add me… bmx_jake@hotmail.com

item.title: Need help with run/Compiling server
item.dc:creator: @wateromg wateromg
item.description:
@wateromg wrote:

u leave every thing alone in it… u just add the Class path and path…
here edit complier and put this in it

@echo off if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Finished! pause exit
click edit on run and put this there

@echo off color 0a title server name java -Xmx512m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.08-ga-bin.jar server

did it work?

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with run/Compiling server
item.dc:creator: @I_pk_u1 I pk u1
item.description:
@I_pk_u1 wrote:

ok I set my variables… they weren’t the problem tho… it still says I need java files for this compiler to compile… any other Ideas…oh and on tht step 4 is path… and I suppossed to get rid of all the other codes in there?

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with run/Compiling server
item.dc:creator: @wateromg wateromg
item.description:
@wateromg wrote:

Step 4
Now you need to set environment variables. It may be challenging for new people, but you will eventually get it.

First of all, open my computer and press view system information. Something will popup with lots of tabs. Select the one that says “advanced” then at the bottom click on environment variables.

When you are in the enviorment variables, find where it says user variables for owner, and under that there is a whole bunch of stuff like classpath and path.

If you already have a thing that says “classpath” inside, then just edit it and put this in
Code:

CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

if you dont create a new variable call it classpath and put that in.

Then find the “Path” variable and edit it and put this in-
Code:

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin;

Now you are done with the environment variables!
Note: If you have another version of jdk, for the part that says _0.6 in both classpath and path, change it to your jdk.

Read full topic
